newsitem.title: FINLAND: Clinton knee injury may delay Latam trips.
newsitem.headline: Clinton knee injury may delay Latam trips.

text.p: President Bill Clinton may have to delay upcoming trips to Mexico and Latin America until after he fully recovers from knee surgery, his spokesman said on Thursday.

"There may be some need to think about that," White House spokesman Mike McCurry told reporters when asked whether the president's planned goodwill visits to countries south of the U.S. border would be postponed.

Clinton, who underwent knee surgery last Friday after tearing a tendon in a stumble at the Florida home of Australian golf pro Greg Norman, is in a wheelchair for his Helsinki summit with Russian President Boris Yeltsin.
"The trip to Latin America was designed to be much different from a meeting like this, which is in a sense, a face-to-face meeting to really work through issues," McCurry said.
Clinton is scheduled to be in Mexico on April 11-12, and visit five Latin American countries -- Barbados, Costa Rica, Argentina, Brazil and Venezuela -- from May 6 to May 13.

McCurry said the president's trips to Latin America were to be ones where he "engages more fully with the people ... and travels," which would be difficult to do with the limited mobility that will plague Clinton for the next several weeks.
"We'll have to kind of look at the schedule and think about it as we think ahead. But we'll let you know if there are any changes in our plans," McCurry said.
